snippet: Practitioners of parkour have long seen public spaces as their playground, and parkour as the ultimate rebel’s game. But now it has turned into a big business.
abstract: Parkour, daring acrobatic pastime born in streets of France, has become a big business in United States, with parkour gyms--featuring juice bars, private classes and children's birthday parties--opening up from California to New York; gym owners say they are broadening the activity's appeal, and making it safer in the process, but hard-core enthusiasts worry that parkour's renegade soul is at risk.
lead_paragraph: Practitioners of parkour have long seen public spaces as their playground, and parkour as the ultimate rebel’s game. But now it has turned into a big business.

headline.main: Parkour, a Pastime Born on the Streets, Moves Indoors and Uptown
headline.print_headline: A Pastime Born on the Streets Moves Indoors and Uptown
